clinical_study.brief_title: Molecular Screening for Cancer Treatment Optimization
clinical_study.official_title: Molecular Screening Analysis Used as Decision Tool for Targeted Molecular Treatment

lead_sponsor.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

clinical_study.source: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to use high throughput molecular analysis (CGH Array and sequencing) to treat patients with metastatic cancer with targeted therapeutics in order to improve the progression free survival compared to the previous treatment line.
The secondary objectives are to investigate clinical practical feasibility of such technics, to potentially improve the overall survival of patients and to describe molecular portrait of Phase 1 candidates.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression free survival (PFS) using a targeted treatment selected by molecular profiling compared to the PFS for the most recent regimen
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of start of targeted treatment oriented by MOSCATO until the date of first progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Progression according to RECIST criteria or clinical progression or death of any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patient who received a targeted treatment oriented by molecular profiling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the start to the end of enrollment, up to 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patient who received a targeted treatment oriented by molecular profiling

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression free Survival, Overall Survival and Response Rate
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison of Progression Free Survival, Overall Survival and Response Rate between patients with targeted treatment and others enrolled patients.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients with non curable metastatic cancer

intervention.description: Every enrolled patient undergoes tumoral biopsy
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients with non curable metastatic cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Solid tumors ; Stade IV ; Local relapse or metastatic ; Uncurable
- Age > 6 months
- PS 0/1 or Lansky play scale >= 70%
- Minimum one treatment line, no limit in the prior number of treatment line
- Evaluable or measurable disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Life expectancy < 3 months
- Carcinomatous meningitis
- Symptomatic or progressive radiologic brain metastasis for non-CNS tumors
- Polynuclear neutrophil < 1 x 10^9/L
- Platelets < 100 x 10^9/L
- Hemoglobin < 90 g/L
- ALT/AST > 2.5 N
- bilirubin > 1.5 N
- Creatinine >1.5 N
- Calcemia > ULN
- Phosphate > ULN
- Coagulation anomaly non-indicated for biopsy
